results.title: Stage Fright
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Brothers First National Productions
results.brief_description: Drama student Eve Gill (Jane Wyman) envisions the acting challenge of a lifetime in the desperate predicament of boyfriend Jonathan Cooper (Richard Todd) who is framed for murder by the flamboyant stage star Charlotte Inwood (Marlene Dietrich). To prove Jonathan’s innocence, the naive Eve impersonates a maid and works for Charlotte but discovers that where murder is involved, life does not follow a script. Representing the glamour and bitchiness of the theatre, movie legend Marlene Dietrich makes the vain, manipulative Charlotte one of her most colourful characterisations and her rendition of Cole Porter’s “The Laziest gal in town” is both sexy and provocative. Co-starring Michael Wilding, Richard Todd, Alistair Sim, Sybil Thorndike, Joyce Grenfell and Kay Walsh. Based on a novel by Selwyn Jepson.

results.title: Stage fright
results.brief_description: Explores the physiology and psychology of stage fright. Explains why a person feels threatened and shows how to overcome these feelings and use them to advantage - making a parachute jump and making a speech can be equally frightening.
results.description: Explores the physiology and psychology of stage fright. Explains why a person feels threatened and shows how to overcome these feelings and use them to advantage - making a parachute jump and making a speech can be equally frightening.

results.title: Stage door canteen
results.creator_credit: Frank Borzage, Sol Lesser and Sol Lesser Productions
results.brief_description: At a Stage Door Canteen in Manhattan, three enlisted men on a one-day pass to New York meet and fall in love with three hostesses working there (Cheryl Walker, Marjorie Riordan, Dorothea Kent). This film is noted for its 60 plus celebrities who star as themselves, rather than the love story that provides the backdrop for their appearance. The setting allows for a cavalcade of musical and comedy numbers as well as cameo appearances. Cast also includes William Terry, Lon McCallister and Michael Harrison.

results.title: Stage door [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gregory La Cava, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: This witty, sparkling comedy about the trials of numerous aspiring stage actresses, features an array of fine performances from up and coming stars of the 30s. Katherine Hepburn plays Terry Randall, a naive heiress, committed to her craft who anticipates work materialising out of sheer professionalism and perseverance. Boarding at a theatrical residence, where an atmosphere of gay penury prevails, Terry’s housemates attempt to demystify her idealism with their realistic take on an actress’ life - the casting couch, sugar daddies, endless futile auditions and a dearth of work for the talented and talent-less alike. Sharing a room with Terry is Jean (Ginger Rogers) a sassy tap dancer, accustomed to clashing with her fellow thespians, who forms a truce with the secretly wealthy Terry. With the show business setting and putting-on-a-show structure of many classic Hollywood musicals, “Stage door” also contains dramatic turns that relay the dark side and perils of the business. Cast includes: Adolphe Menjou, Lucille Ball, Eve Arden, Ann Miller, Constance Collier. Adapted from the Edna Ferber and George S. Kaufman stage hit.

results.title: Stadium
results.brief_description:
Short experimental film capturing the atmosphere of Melbourne’s iconic MCG stadium at night whilst hosting a soccer match during the 2000 Sydney Olympics.
No commentary, using sound effects only.

results.title: Stack
results.brief_description: In ‘Stack’, sound artist Ros Bandt captures sounds from the city stack emissions, a 55 metre chimney stack that extracts fumes from the Citylink tunnel. Sounds from the cylinder, the external grid and internal resonant surfaces, along with ambient sounds of the industrial extractor fans and builders working were recorded. Sections of the steel frame were electrified in order to generate original percussion timbres. The tunnel footage was shot and edited by Martin Wright.

results.title: Stachka = Strike (Musical soundtrack)
results.brief_description:
Eisenstein conceived his first film not as the portrayal of an actual historical event but as a generalised picture of a strike without individual heroes; the mass is a collective hero represented by types rather than characters.of poster-like sketches containing Eisenstein’s first experiments with montage both for direct emotional impact (collision) and for the presentation of abstract ideas (metaphor). A constructivist approach is evident in the way machinery is represented not as dominating the workers but as being enlisted by them in the struggle. Also available on VHS, LD and 16mm.

Credits: Director, Sergei Eisenstein ; photographer, E. Tisse, Vassili Khvatov ; [producer, Boris Mikhine ; script, Sergei Eisenstein, V. Pletniev, I. Kravtchunovsky, Grigori Alexandrov].
Cast: [Grigori Alexandrov, Maxim Strauch, Mikhail Gomarov], credited as Troupe of the workers Theatre.

results.title: Stabilizing soft sites
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how wet clay building sites can be cheaply and effectively stabilised by the addition of hydrated lime before building operations begin. This reduces expensive hold-ups due to bogged vehicles and the generally unpleasant conditions which prevail on a clay building site in winter.
results.description: Demonstrates how wet clay building sites can be cheaply and effectively stabilised by the addition of hydrated lime before building operations begin. results.title: Stabbing at Leia's
results.brief_description: You may or may not know Josh Trank directed a short film that was inspired by the Star Wars universe called “Stabbing at Leia’s.” It was made back in 2007 and it was done in the same style that he directed Chronicle. In fact, this is the short that help him land the Chronicle directing gig.

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.
